text: I had "Space Pilaf" for lunch at the cafeteria of JAXA, Sagamihara campus.
Next, I will study about the cosmos!
A free tour is available here at the exhibition room of JAXA, Sagamihara campus.
This is Hayabusa2, an asteroid explorer.
When I visited, full-size mockups of Hayabusa and Hayabusa2 could be seen.
From this part, that famous picture of the Earth was taken.
The asteroid, Itokawa, looks like me, doesn't it?
A model of the capsule, which Hayabusa brought back from the asteroid, Itokawa.
It weighs as much as the real thing!
I am really pleased, because I bought space food, takoyaki!
Now, back to studying about meals!
I am at niebana to eat a "one soup and three dishes" meal which has good nutritional balance.
Shiny rice cooked, using an iron pot!
Miso soup, for one soup.
Chicken nanban is the main dish.
The side dishes are broiled red fish and simmered dry daikon.
A "one soup and three dishes" meal is served with a portion for one person.
I will have another dish, and try mixing the tastes in my mouth!
First, I will eat it with white rice...
To finish it off, pour green tea and make ochazuke.
I heard an interesting story from Mr. Hattori in the end.
Eating meals together with someone else is a wonderful thing!
The key word is "Itadakimasu", or, "Let's eat!"
I must go now; Chef is waiting for me!
